meanings.definition: To work or move slowly and with difficulty.
meanings.sent1: She trachled through the thick mud to reach the other side of the field.
meanings.sent2: The old car trachled up the steep hill, barely making progress.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, she continued to trachle through the tangled mess of wires.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts trachled along, unable to find a clear path forward.
meanings.sent5: The heavy backpack trachled on her shoulders, weighing her down.

meanings.sent1: Fixing the broken fence was a real trachle for him.
meanings.sent2: Completing the project on time proved to be quite a trachle for the team.
meanings.sent3: Carrying all those boxes up the stairs was a trachle, but they managed it.
meanings.sent4: The journey through the dense forest was a trachle they would never forget.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle turned out to be a real trachle, taking hours to solve.

meanings.sent1: He trachled to improve his grades before the final exams.
meanings.sent2: The team trachled to come back from behind and win the game.
meanings.sent3: The little bird trachled to build its nest with twigs bigger than itself.
meanings.sent4: She trachled against the strong currents to reach the shore.
meanings.sent5: The determined ant trachled to carry the heavy crumb back to its colony.
